org_name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
parent_system: The Ohio State University Health System

request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Medical Information (with instructions)
Mail to Medical Information Management offices (3 locations)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a generic Authorization to Release Medical Information PDF, print and complete it by hand, and mail it to one of three Medical Information Management offices.

red_flags: Mandatory 'Purpose of Disclosure' for all requests including patient self-access, which HIPAA does not require
Fee questions directed to CIOX Health with no fee schedule or distinction between patient-access and third-party fees
Form last revised November 2019, predating 2021 information blocking rules and 2024 42 CFR Part 2 revisions
bright_spots: Dedicated instructions page with 7 numbered items mapped to form sections
Granular record-type selection with 11 checkbox categories
Multi-facility selection across 8 OSU locations with guidance to 'select all' if uncertain
Accepts eSignatures (e.g., Adobe) with date/time stamp
Correct substance use disorder (42 CFR Part 2) and psychotherapy notes disclosures

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms found on the first web search attempt with direct download links from the Medical Records page; minor confusion from two versions with no guidance on which to use.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — the PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields, no electronic submission channel (no fax, email, or portal for submission), requiring patients to print, handwrite, and mail the form.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with a dedicated instructions page, logical flow, and granular record-type options; minor issues with dense layout on the form page, small font in legal sections, and some HIPAA jargon.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic authorization form but it was not designed for self-access — no differentiation from third-party release, no mention of Right of Access, and mandatory purpose disclosure.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Requires purpose of disclosure for all requests (not required by HIPAA for patient access), fee opacity through CIOX Health with no schedule provided; offset by no notarization requirement, appropriate anti-conditioning language, and correct sensitive-records disclosures.

overall.summary: OSU Wexner Medical Center offers a findable and reasonably well-designed ROI form with useful instructions, but the lack of fillable fields, mail-only submission, no patient self-access differentiation, and opaque fee structure result in a fundamentally paper-based, third-party-oriented process.
